intro: Parathesis rufa, commonly known as the red-stemmed parathesis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive reddish stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
